fastaContainerFactory
========================
Usage
--------    
.. code-block:: python

   import pyproteinsExt.fastaContainer as fasta
   fastaContainer = fasta.parse("your_file.fasta")

You can iterate through fastaContainer

.. code-block:: python

   for f in fastaContainer:
      print(f.prot)
      print(f.seq)
      print(f.header)

Will print::

    tr|A0A2E7ABP2|A0A2E7ABP2_9EURY
    tr|A0A2E7ABP2|A0A2E7ABP2_9EURY Uncharacterized protein OS=Euryarchaeota archaeon OX=2026739 GN=CMA54_04070 PE=4 SV=1
    MSRPHFHSEKPYSVGDIRVGHSHAHQLVEAETGRQGRDFLGFTIKDLGRQSGELTRLSVGDWLAIRGPFGTAFPQMNAGERLVLVSGGIGSTPMHMAAREARHRLGDDVRIEAIMGFRNAEESHYVSRMESICDSLRITTDDGSLGTQGFPTALLPELLGNYHDGRTVLLTCGPEPMMLPVLQMAVDSAIKCYAAMERYLPCSMAVCGLCMVGDRLICKDGPVMDGDWLLQQDDFGSSHGHWAAVG
    tr|A0A2V4DJ72|A0A2V4DJ72_9EURY
    tr|A0A2V4DJ72|A0A2V4DJ72_9EURY Uncharacterized protein OS=Euryarchaeota archaeon OX=2026739 GN=CXX81_02360 PE=4 SV=1
    
    ...

You can access to one specific entry with its prot attribute

.. code-block:: python

   second_entry = fastaContainer.entries["tr|A0A2V4DJ72|A0A2V4DJ72_9EURY"]
   print(second_entry.seq)

Will print::
